meanings.definition: A piece of cowhide used as a flap on a saddle.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy adjusted the cowflap on his saddle before riding off.
meanings.sent2: The cowflap on the saddle kept the rider comfortable during the long journey.
meanings.sent3: When the cowflap on the saddle fell off, it looked like a cow trying to fly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed like a cowflap flapping in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sun gleamed on the cowflap, making it shine like a golden shield.

meanings.definition: A derogatory term for a foolish or clumsy person.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a cowflap and make silly mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He felt like a cowflap when he tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent3: She teased him, calling him a cowflap for forgetting his lunch.
meanings.sent4: His behavior at the party was as awkward as a cowflap in a ballet class.
meanings.sent5: The new employee was a real cowflap, always causing trouble in the office.
